mite. Ecologists like to use insects

they're small and you can do it

well, that doesn't even qualify

And these are experiments that
have illustrated the concept of

keystone predator. There are some predators and
ecosystems that are what are

called keystones. And that is if you remove them,
the entire structure of the

community changes. There are some that if you move
them, it doesn't have a dramatic

effect, but there are certain
ones that are keystone predators

that it does. And these, of course,
are species that conservation

biologists want to first
identify, and second conserve

above others because there is a
cascade of effects if something

happens to them. A classic example of this was a

ago in the inner tidal

over everything and eliminate
the predator from certain areas.

At what he showed was that
that's what that ecosystem looks like if you eliminate the
